revised_title: The Resistance of Anthrax to Heat: A Study on Sterilization Techniques
tldr: This study investigates the resistance of anthrax bacteria to heat and aims to determine the necessary temperature and duration of heating to effectively sterilize water for troops in the field. The authors conducted experiments using sealed glass tubes exposed to heat in steam at various temperatures and times. The results showed that anthrax bacteria were rarely found to survive even at temperatures of 100°C for as short as 20-30 seconds. This research provides valuable insights into effective sterilization techniques for water purification in military settings.
